23  package com.dd.plist;
24  
25  import java.io.IOException;
26  
27  /**
28   * A UID. Only found in binary property lists that are keyed archives.
29   *
30   * @author Daniel Dreibrodt
31   */
32  public class UID extends NSObject {
33  
34      private byte[] bytes;
35      private String name;
36  
37      public UID(String name, byte[] bytes) {
38          this.name = name;
39          this.bytes = bytes;
40      }
41  
42      public byte[] getBytes() {
43          return bytes;
44      }
45  
46      public String getName() {
47          return name;
48      }
49  
50      /**
51       * There is no XML representation specified for UIDs.
52       * In this implementation UIDs are represented as strings in the XML output.
53       *
54       * @param xml   The xml StringBuilder
55       * @param level The indentation level
56       */
57      @Override
58      void toXML(StringBuilder xml, int level) {
59          indent(xml, level);
60          xml.append("<string>");
61          for (int i = 0; i < bytes.length; i++) {
62              byte b = bytes[i];
63              if (b < 16)
64                  xml.append("0");
65              xml.append(Integer.toHexString(b));
66          }
67          xml.append("</string>");
68      }
69  
70      @Override
71      void toBinary(BinaryPropertyListWriter out) throws IOException {
72          out.write(0x80 + bytes.length - 1);
73          out.write(bytes);
74      }
75  
76      @Override
77      protected void toASCII(StringBuilder ascii, int level) {
78          indent(ascii, level);
79          ascii.append("\"");
80          for (int i = 0; i < bytes.length; i++) {
81              byte b = bytes[i];
82              if (b < 16)
83                  ascii.append("0");
84              ascii.append(Integer.toHexString(b));
85          }
86          ascii.append("\"");
87      }
88  
89      @Override
90      protected void toASCIIGnuStep(StringBuilder ascii, int level) {
91          toASCII(ascii, level);
92      }
93  }
